title: Best supermarket chicken tikka masala ready meals for National Curry Week
text:

The best week of the year is here: nope, not Christmas... National Curry week.

And to help you celebrate, we took on the mighty job of ranking supermarket's own-brand Indian ready meals in a blind taste test to find out which you can eat instead of the usual expensive takeaway, and which ones aren't even worth waiting three minutes at the microwave for.

In a recent study on Brit's top ten favourite curries, Uber Eats found that chicken tikka masala takes the top spot, followed by a classic korma and jerk chicken curry, so for our taste test, we decided to compare the good old chicken tikka.

Microwaveable chicken tikka ready meals were tested from eight supermarkets in total, including M&S, Waitrose, Aldi, Co-op, Morrisons, Sainsbury's, Iceland and Asda - and there was one very surprising winner.

Iceland took top spot for their £2.69 classic chicken tikka masala, which scored five out of five for its perfect levels of spice and a decent coating of sauce, despite being the second cheapest option in the mix - and the same price as Aldi.

In second place was none other than Marks and Spencer, with 4.5 out of 5 - perfect timing, considering they've just launched their brand new 'Best Ever Tikka Masala', which we can confirm is indeed, one of the best.

But whilst M&S' offering costs £5 per dish (or you can get it alongside another curry, plus two sides for £10 in the meal deal), Iceland's costs half that, at just £2.69.

We've got the full list of ratings below, so you can see if your favourite matches up to our curry critics'.

Beautifully flavoured creamy sauce with the perfect level of spice, paired with tender chicken.

The marinade makes this, with its succulent flame-grilled chicken taking centre stage with a restaurant-style sauce to go with.

Nicely balanced sauce thats strong but not punchy - which is good as you get a lot of it! However the packaging needs some work, as two out of three of the samples leaking in transit.

Creamy but not too tomatoey, could do with a touch of extra spice though.

Big fans of the box, as it looks just like a takeaway container so you can keep it for storing your future food in. No major spice notes but a lot of tomato.

Co-op Chicken Tikka Masala and Pilau rice, £2.75, 2.5/5

You get a lot of sauce with this, and there's not much spice in there. Best after a night out if you're already struggling with the acid reflux.

Aldi Speciality Selected Irresistibly Creamy Chicken Tikka Masala, £2.69: 2/5

Big chicken pieces but pretty tasteless sadly.

Overly sweet sauce and does not fit with the dish. The three different flavours of chicken together doesn't work very well either. Very good level of spice though.
description: It's National Curry week, so to celebrate, we've rated all the supermarket's chicken tikka ready meals, from Aldi to M&S
